text: I agree regarding the speed and complexity. Look at something like Hawkeye to capture motion of cricket ball which is a VERY simple problem by comparison. You basically just need to fit an ellipse to the outputs of some edge detection. Cameras positioned accurately to optimise that. Not sure if they do that in real time or just run it after the ball has been delivered. Imagine a foggy February day over the fences trying to use image recognition in a 20 strong field. Really can't see it being feasible.

text: I have never had a problem with horse racing.  It brings back the data whether it is UK, Ireland or US every time. text: Suppose I want to hedge/green a matched back bet with a lay. The lay is in the order book. I want to move the lay order (either up or down), while adjusting the size so that it will still hedge/green the back bet correctly. What is the best way to do that in Flumine?

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

elements.text: Suppose I want to hedge/green a matched back bet with a lay. The lay is in the order book. I want to move the lay order (either up or down), while adjusting the size so that it will still hedge/green the back bet correctly. What is the best way to do that in Flumine?

text: I would always recommend a cancel and then a new place based off your position after the cancel, if you cancel with a size reduction then move there is the chance of a match during the process

elements.text: I would always recommend a cancel and then a new place based off your position after the cancel, if you cancel with a size reduction then move there is the chance of a match during the process

text: FILL_OR_KILL might be an option depending on whether your offering or taking

text: But if you cancel and then new place, and you are betting before inplay, there is a risk that the market goes inplay.:disappointed:

text: I think it comes down to the strategy. Ill always argue for hedge over bet to win purely because of bank size, but there does become a point where you move the market too much, weaker horses can be a nightmare

text: But if you taking value then why give some of it up? If your hedges are profitable by themselves then great but the market is normally too efficient for that to be the case

elements.text: But if you taking value then why give some of it up? If your hedges are profitable by themselves then great but the market is normally too efficient for that to be the case

text: bank size can be like 5-6 times smaller when trading odds and hedge vs bet to win. For me its worth giving up 1-2% on the strategy, for smaller bank roll with higher consistent strike rate.
